UnavailableFunction.description:
Description

Due to Objective-C and Swift interoperability some functions are often required to be implemented but
arenâ€™t really needed. It is extremely common that the sole implementation of the functions consist of throwing
a fatal error. Marking these functions as unavailable prevents them from being executed while still making
the compiler happy.

Example(s):

UnavailableFunction.option: This rule has no specific options.
